Detailed Description

The QLedMatrix widget simulates a LED matrix (dot matrix) display.

A LED matrix display is a 2-dimensional array of dots used to generate characters, symbols and images. It is often seen on machines, clocks and display boards.

This generic implementation can configured for any size of rows (greater than 0) and columns. The number of colors is not limited, therefore it can be used to make a monochrome, bi-color or even a full RGB display.

Individual LEDs can be addressed in the matrix by their row and column position. The index (0,0) is located in the upper left corner. Columns grow from left to right, and rows grow from top to bottom.

Version:
0.6
Author:
Pierre-Etienne Messier <pierre.etienne.messier@gmail.com>

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum QLedMatrix::LEDColor

This type defines standard LED colors in the QRgb format, provided purely for convenience.

See also:
QRgb
Enumerator:
NoColor  Default dark LED color (#222222)
Red  Red (#FF0000)
Green  Green (#00FF00)
Blue  Blue (#0000FF)
White  White (#FFFFFF)
Orange  Orange (#FF8800)
OrangeRed  Orange-Red (#FF2200)
Yellow  Yellow (#FFFF00)

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

QLedMatrix::QLedMatrix ( QWidget *  parent = 0  ) 

Constructs a LED Matrix display, sets the background color to black, the background mode to opaque, the dark LED color to QLedMatrix::NoColor and the number of rows and columns to 0.

See also:
setBackgroundColor(), setBackgroundMode(), setDarkLedColor(), setRowCount(), setColumnCount()
Parameters:
parent parent QWidget

QLedMatrix::~QLedMatrix (  )  [virtual]

Destroys the LED Matrix display.

void QLedMatrix::clear (  ) 

Clears the LED Matrix display.

When the display is cleared, all the LEDs are set to the dark LED color.

See also:
darkLedColor(), setDarkLedColor()

QRgb QLedMatrix::colorAt ( int  row,
int  col 
) const

Returns the color of the LED at the specified position.

This function uses the QRgb data format. If the specified position is invalid, this function will return the current dark LED color.

Parameters:
row the row index of the LED
col the column index of the LED
Returns:
the color of the LED at the given position
See also:
setColorAt(), darkLedColor()

void QLedMatrix::setBackgroundColor ( const QColor &  color  ) 

Sets the background color of the widget to the given color.

The background color of the widget will only be visible if the background mode is set to Qt::OpaqueMode.

void QLedMatrix::setBackgroundMode ( Qt::BGMode  mode  ) 

Sets the background mode of the widget to the given mode.

Qt::OpaqueMode (the default) fills the widget's background with the current background color. Qt::TransparentMode doesn't draw any background color.

Parameters:
mode the background mode to be set
See also:
backgroundMode(), backgroundColor(), setBackgroundColor()

void QLedMatrix::setColorAt ( int  row,
int  col,
QRgb  rgb 
)

Sets the given color to the LED at the specified position.

If the specified position is invalid, this function will do nothing.

Parameters:
row the row index of the LED
col the column index of the LED
rgb the color to be set (in QRgb format)
See also:
colorAt()

void QLedMatrix::setColumnCount ( int  columns  ) 

Sets the number of columns in the LED matrix display.

This function will do nothing if the new number of columns is less than 0 or if it is equal to the current number of columns. If the new number of columns is less than the current number of columns, the display will be cropped to the new value. Otherwise, if the new number of columns is greater than the current number of columns, the new LEDs will be initialized using the dark LED color.

Parameters:
columns the new number of columns
See also:
columnCount(), setRowCount(), darkLedColor()

void QLedMatrix::setDarkLedColor ( const QColor &  color  ) 

Sets the dark LED color to the given color.

The dark LED color is used to represent a LED in the 'off' state. It is used when adding rows or cols, and when using the clear() method.

Parameters:
color the color to be set
See also:
darkLedColor(), clear(), setRowCount(), setColumnCount()

void QLedMatrix::setRowCount ( int  rows  ) 

Sets the number of rows in the LED matrix display.

This function will do nothing if the new number of rows is less than 0 or if it is equal to the current number of rows. If the new number of rows is less than the current number of rows, the display will be cropped to the new value. Otherwise, if the new number of rows is greater than the current number of rows, the new LEDs will be initialized using the dark LED color.

Parameters:
rows the new number of rows
See also:
rowsCount(), setColumnCount(), darkLedColor()
